required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Rate Range Finding Study of Propofol for minimal-to Moderate Sedation on Upper & Lower Endoscopic Tests
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-centre, Single-blind, Randomised, Parallel Group, Phase IIb Dose Rate Range Finding Study to Find Maintenance Dose Rate Range of ICI35,868 for the Minimal-to-moderate Sedation on Gastrointestinal Endoscopic Tests (Including Endoscopic Polypectomy)

brief_summary.textblock: Phase IIB study to find the optimal dose rate range of propofol to maintain minimal-to-moderate sedation for diagnostic gastrointestinal endoscopy and gastrointestinal polypectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Observers Assessment of Alertness/Sedation (MOAA/S) Score 2 Minutes From Beginning of Maintenance Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes from the beginning of the maintenance period
primary_outcome.description: The MOAA/S is a 6-point ordinal scale measuring a patient's level of sedation. Scores range from 0 (No response to painful stimulus [trapezius squeeze]) to 5 (Responds readily to name spoken in normal tone [awake]). MOAA/S scores were classified as 0-1, 2-4 and 5.

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Observers Assessment of Alertness/Sedation (MOAA/S) Score 4 Minutes From Beginning of Maintenance Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 minutes from the beginning of the maintenance period
primary_outcome.description: The MOAA/S is a 6-point ordinal scale measuring a patient's level of sedation. Scores range from 0 (No response to painful stimulus [trapezius squeeze]) to 5 (Responds readily to name spoken in normal tone [awake]). MOAA/S scores were classified as 0-1, 2-4 and 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction With Sedation Instrument (PSSI) Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 - 48 hours after completion of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The PSSI is a 100-point visual analog scale measuring a patient's satisfaction with sedation. Scores range from 0 (Very dissatisfied) to 100 (Very satisfied).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the initiation period and every 2 minutes during the maintenance period

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Observers Assessment of Alertness/Sedation (MOAA/S) at End of Initiation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Last measurement in maintenance period (3 minutes for arms 1-5; 1 minute for arm 6, 5 minute for arm 7)
secondary_outcome.description: The MOAA/S is a 6-point ordinal scale measuring a patient's level of sedation. Scores range from 0 (No response to painful stimulus [trapezius squeeze]) to 5 (Responds readily to name spoken in normal tone [awake]). MOAA/S scores were classified as 0-1, 2-4 and 5.

intervention.description: Infusion of placebo, same infusion rates as for arm 2
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.17 mg/kg for 3 minutes followed by maintenance with 25 µg/kg/minute
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.33 mg/kg for 3 minutes followed by maintenance with 50 µg/kg/minute
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.5 mg/kg for 3 minutes followed by maintenance with 75 µg/kg/minute
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.8 mg/kg for 3 minutes followed by maintenance with 120 µg/kg/minute
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.5 mg/kg for 1 minutes followed by maintenance with 75 µg/kg/minute
Infusion of propofol: initiation with 0.5 mg/kg for 5 minutes followed by maintenance with 75 µg/kg/minute

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female (females of child bearing potential to confirm not pregnant via test or contraception)
- Be undergoing a non-emergent esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) or colonoscopy, including polypectomy that shall be completed within 1 hour
Exclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) grade III, IV V and VI
- Baseline oxygen saturation<90% (room air)
- Body Mass Index (BMI) >=35

overall_official.affiliation: Physician Group, Clinical Division, R&D, Astrazeneca K.K.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 2 centers were initiated with first patient enrolled on 23 August 2010 and last patient completed on 17 November. A total of 129 patients were enrolled with 123 qualified patients allocated to randomized treatment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The patients enrolled in this study were undergoing non-emergent standard esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) or colonoscopy. Six patients were withdrawn from the study after enrollment but before randomization: 5 patients due to excess recruitment and one patient due to investigator's recommendation..

measure.title: Procedures
measure.description: Patients underwent either esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) or colonoscopy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If the PI wants to publish the results, the PI must send the English documents to AZ beforehand. And AZ can review and revise the documents, after that, AZ will give the approval to the PI about the publication of the results.
